page.title: 04ST.JAMES' CHURCH,DEVIZES.
page.content: St.James' Church has a fine tower which is eighty feet high and dates from the 15th century.It still bears the marks of shot holes which it received in 1643,when General Sir Willam Waller attempted to take the Castle and Town. The Church was rebuilt in 1832 in perpendicular style and stands by the great pond on the green called The Crammer. The congregation generally numbers about 350 people and there are on average 30 Christenings and 25 to 50 weddings a year.The Church is closly associated with Southbroom Junior School and services are held involving the pupils at Christmas and Easter. The Vicar of St James' often takes morning assembly at the school.
